channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- PowerScale OneFS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- PowerScale OneFS

item.title: CVE-2022-23161|2024-09-16T19:26:03.465Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x - 9.3.0.x contain a denial-of-service vulnerability in SmartConnect. An unprivileged network attacker may potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2022-22561|2024-09-16T19:50:45.537Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 8.2.x-9.3.0.x, contain an improper restriction of excessive authentication attempts. An unauthenticated remote attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to compromised accounts.

item.title: CVE-2021-21527|2024-09-16T18:28:26.897Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS 8.1.0-9.1.0 contain an improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS command vulnerability. This vulnerability may allow an authenticated user with ISI_PRIV_LOGIN_SSH or ISI_PRIV_LOGIN_CONSOLE privileges to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-26851|2024-09-16T16:58:03.640Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, 8.2.2-9.3.x, contains a predictable file name from observable state vulnerability. An unprivileged network attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to data loss.

item.title: CVE-2021-36305|2024-09-16T18:33:24.071Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS contains an Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context in SMB CA handling. An authenticated user of SMB on a cluster with CA could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to a denial of service over SMB.

item.title: CVE-2022-34371|2024-09-16T18:54:15.387Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.0.0 up to and including 9.1.0.19, 9.2.1.12, 9.3.0.6, and 9.4.0.3, contain an unprotected transport of credentials vulnerability. A malicious unprivileged network attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to full system compromise.

item.title: CVE-2020-26196|2024-09-16T18:24:05.636Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell EMC PowerScale OneFS versions 8.1.0-9.1.0 contain a Backup/Restore Privilege implementation issue. A user with the BackupAdmin role may potentially exploit this vulnerability resulting in the ability to write data outside of the intended file system location.

item.title: CVE-2022-34439|2024-09-16T16:22:45.210Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 8.2.0.x-9.4.0.x contain allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service and performance issue on that node.

item.title: CVE-2021-21563|2024-09-16T18:07:53.791Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell EMC PowerScale OneFS versions 8.1.2-9.1.0.x contain an Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions in its auditing component.This can lead to an authenticated user with low-privileges to trigger a denial of service event.

item.title: CVE-2020-26181|2024-09-16T18:12:49.554Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell EMC Isilon OneFS versions 8.1 and later and Dell EMC PowerScale OneFS version 9.0.0 contain a privilege escalation vulnerability on a SmartLock Compliance mode cluster. The compadmin user connecting using ISI PRIV LOGIN SSH or ISI PRIV LOGIN CONSOLE can elevate privileges to the root user if they have ISI PRIV HARDENING privileges.

item.title: CVE-2021-21561|2024-09-16T19:20:53.782Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS version 8.1.2 contains a sensitive information exposure vulnerability. This would allow a malicious user with ISI_PRIV_LOGIN_SSH and/or ISI_PRIV_LOGIN_CONSOLE privileges to gain access to sensitive information in the log files.

item.title: CVE-2021-21502|2024-09-16T17:07:42.336Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.1.0 â€“ 9.1.0 contain a "use of SSH key past account expiration" vulnerability. A user on the network with the ISI_PRIV_AUTH_SSH RBAC privilege that has an expired account may potentially exploit this vulnerability, giving them access to the same things they had before account expiration. This may by a high privileged account and hence Dell recommends customers upgrade at the earliest opportunity.

item.title: CVE-2022-34369|2024-09-16T18:04:21.189Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.0.0 up to and including 9.1.0.20, 9.2.1.13, 9.3.0.6, and 9.4.0.3 , contain an insertion of sensitive information in log files vulnerability. A remote unprivileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to exposure of this sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2022-31237|2024-09-16T17:29:10.826Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.2.0 up to and including 9.2.1.12 and 9.3.0.5 contain an improper preservation of permissions vulnerability in SyncIQ. A low privileged local attacker may potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to limited information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2020-26197|2024-09-16T17:23:27.293Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS 8.1.0 - 9.1.0 contains an LDAP Provider inability to connect over TLSv1.2 vulnerability. It may make it easier to eavesdrop and decrypt such traffic for a malicious actor. Note: This does not affect clusters which are not relying on an LDAP server for the authentication provider.

item.title: CVE-2022-34437|2024-09-16T18:24:02.061Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 8.2.2-9.3.0, contain an OS command injection vulnerability. A privileged local malicious user could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to a full system compromise. This impacts compliance mode clusters.

item.title: CVE-2022-31230|2024-09-16T18:18:12.648Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 8.2.x-9.2.x, contain broken or risky cryptographic algorithm. A remote unprivileged malicious attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to full system access.

item.title: CVE-2022-22559|2024-09-16T16:44:04.745Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, version 9.3.0, contains a use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm. An unprivileged network attacker could exploit this vulnerability, leading to the potential for information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-24412|2024-09-16T16:48:37.369Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell EMC PowerScale OneFS 8.2.x - 9.3.0.x contain an improper handling of value vulnerability. An unprivileged network attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2022-22565|2024-09-16T19:25:47.667Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.0.0-9.3.0, contain an improper authorization of index containing sensitive information. An authenticated and privileged user could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to disclosure or modification of sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2020-26191|2024-09-16T18:28:39.223Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell EMC PowerScale OneFS versions 8.1.0 - 9.1.0 contain a privilege escalation vulnerability. A user with ISI_PRIV_JOB_ENGINE may use the PermissionRepair job to grant themselves the highest level of RBAC privileges thus being able to read arbitrary data, tamper with system software or deny service to users.

item.title: CVE-2021-21528|2024-09-16T19:14:56.490Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell EMC PowerScale OneFS versions 9.1.0, 9.2.0.x, 9.2.1.x contain an Exposure of Information through Directory Listing vulnerability. This vulnerability is triggered when upgrading from a previous versions.

item.title: CVE-2021-21506|2024-09-16T16:29:02.819Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: PowerScale OneFS 8.1.2,8.2.2 and 9.1.0 contains an improper input sanitization issue in its API handler. An un-authtenticated with ISI_PRIV_SYS_SUPPORT and ISI_PRIV_LOGIN_PAPI privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to potential privileges escalation.

item.title: CVE-2024-39579|2024-09-03T13:58:37.196Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.8.0.0 contains an incorrect privilege assignment vulnerability. A local high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain root-level access.

item.title: CVE-2024-25964|2024-08-23T18:53:32.886Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS 9.5.0.x through 9.7.0.x contain a covert timing channel vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-25963|2024-08-15T19:14:32.092Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 8.2.2.x through 9.5.0.x contains a use of a broken cryptographic algorithm vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2024-32854|2024-08-02T02:20:35.664Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.8.0.0 contain an improper privilege management vulnerability. A local high privilege attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2024-32852|2024-08-02T02:20:35.683Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.7.0.0 contain use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm vulnerability. An unprivileged network malicious attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to data leaks.

item.title: CVE-2024-32853|2024-08-02T02:20:35.609Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.7.0.2 contain an execution with unnecessary privileges vulnerability. A local low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-25954|2024-08-01T14:55:29.197Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.5.0.x through 9.7.0.x, contain an insufficient session expiration vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-32853|2024-07-09T20:20:22.775Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.7.0.2 contain an execution with unnecessary privileges vulnerability. A local low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-37134|2024-07-02T19:49:29.753Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.8.0.0 contain an improper privilege management vulnerability. A local high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain root-level access.

item.title: CVE-2024-37132|2024-07-02T14:04:16.768Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.8.0.0 contain an incorrect privilege assignment vulnerability. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Denial of service and Elevation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-32852|2024-07-02T06:57:01.964Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.7.0.0 contain use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm vulnerability. An unprivileged network malicious attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to data leaks.

item.title: CVE-2024-29170|2024-06-05T13:53:29.548Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x through 9.8.0.x contain a use of hard coded credentials vulnerability. An adjacent network unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to information disclosure of network traffic and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-25964|2024-06-04T17:35:51.560Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS 9.5.0.x through 9.7.0.x contain a covert timing channel vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-25952|2024-06-04T17:35:48.725Z -- dell -- powerscale%20onefs
item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.7.0.x contains an UNIX symbolic link (symlink) following vulnerability. A local high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service, information tampering.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x through 9.7.0.2 contains a use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to information disclosure.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x through 9.7.0.1 contains an allocation of resources without limits or throttling vulnerability. A local unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 9.4.0.x through 9.7.0.x contains an UNIX symbolic link (symlink) following vulnerability. A local high privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service, information tampering.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x through 9.7.0.2 contains an external control of file name or path vulnerability. A local high privilege attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS, versions 9.5.0.x through 9.7.0.x, contain an insufficient session expiration vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 9.4.0.x through 9.7.0.x contains an insertion of sensitive information into log file vulnerability. A low privileged local attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to sensitive information disclosure, escalation of privileges.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.2.x through 9.7.0.x contains a cleartext transmission of sensitive information vulnerability. A local low privileged attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to escalation of privileges.

item.description: Dell PowerScale OneFS versions 8.2.x through 9.7.0.2 contains an improper handling of unexpected data type vulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.
